title: Peer Effect-Driven Ability-Based Class Grouping Strategies: Improving Language Learning Achievement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language learning theories and comprehension of peer learning concepts
context.additional_context: Focuses on ability-based class grouping strategies for language proficiency improvement targeting current practitioners, utilizing individual BYOD environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of peer effects on language learning achievement through at least three research case studies
Learners can analyze situational advantages and disadvantages of ability-based class grouping and propose implementation strategies
Learners can design peer group formation strategies tailored to learner levels using formative assessment data
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
